questions.questionText: Riddle: What month of the year has 28 days?
questions.solutionText: All of the 12 months of the year have the 28th day.

questions.questionText: Who was the 'Great Dissenter' in the Philippines?
questions.solutionText: He was called as such for his stand against the pro-American policy of R. Magsaysay.

questions.questionText: Tweedledum and Tweedledee are two characters of which Children’s book?
questions.solutionText: Tweedledee and tweedledum are a pair of identical twins in Alice in the Wonderland.

questions.questionText: What temple of Athena still sits today atop Athens’ Acropolis?
questions.solutionText: Built in the 5th century B.C., it was a symbol pf the power,wealth and elevated culture of Athens
questions.hintText: It was the largest and most lavish temple the Greek mainland had ever seen.

questions.questionText: Riddle: It’s so fragile that if you say its name you break it, what is it?
Who is the main speaker of "The Allegory of the Cave"?
questions.solutionText: After Socrates was executed, Plato wrote a number of dialogues in which Socrates is the main speaker.
questions.hintText: According to Plato, he is portrayed as a "messenger of the Gods".

questions.questionTexts: It is the principle of giving a group priority over each individual in it.
questions.solutionText: Collectivism is a value that is characterized by prioritization of the group over the self.

questions.questionText: What is the scholarly abbreviation of the Latin phrase "and others"?
questions.solutionText: Et al. is used in academic citation when referring to a source with multiple authors.
questions.hintText: You use it a lot when you do your research.

questions.questionText: Which country awards the Pulitzer Prize?
questions.solutionText: The Pulitzer prize is an award for journalism, literature, and musical composition within the U.S.
questions.hintText: It established in 1917 by provisions in the will of Joseph Pulitzer.

questions.questionText: Which one is the first tragedy play of Shakespeare?
questions.solutionText: The play is often seen as Shakespeare’s attempt to emulate the violent plays of his contemporaries.
questions.hintText: The play begins shortly after the death of the Roman emperor.
